content:
There are many designer collaborations with mass-market brands, as well as designer ready-to-wear lines that you can consider. Here are a few examples:

1. H&M designer collaborations - H&M has collaborated with numerous designers, including Balmain, Alexander Wang, and Moschino, to create affordable collections that feature high-end designs.

2. Zara - While not technically a designer brand, Zara is known for its high-end designs that are heavily influenced by current fashion trends. They offer a wide range of clothing and accessories that are fashion-forward and often similar to what you might find in a high-end designer boutique.

3. Versace for H&M - In 2011, Versace collaborated with H&M to release an exclusive line of clothing that included bold prints, flashy colors and alluring cuts.

4. Michael Michael Kors - The designer’s diffusion line is a more affordable alternative to his high-end collection, and is available at stores like Neiman Marcus and Bloomingdales.

5. Proenza Schouler - The New York based label's brand is one that prides itself on its design elements which can be found in its sister line, PSWL. The line is a more accessible range of laid-back, luxe pieces that include tees and hoodies to more complex sweater dresses and cargo pants.

These are just a few examples, as many designers now offer ready-to-wear collections or collaborations with mass-market brands. By exploring these options, you will be able to find high-fashion pieces that suit your budget and style preferences.
